gui

Class SetupShipHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • gui.SetupShipHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.EventListener, javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent>

    public class SetupShipHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent>
    Called when player clicks a button in the right panel.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      Sets up the instance variables of this class depending on which player is in the setup phase

    • Constructor Detail

      • SetupShipHandler

        public SetupShipHandler(javafx.scene.Scene scn,
                        int shipLen,
                        javafx.scene.layout.BorderPane rt,
                        java.lang.String playerSettingUp,
                        int numOfShips,
                        BoardGUI bigBoard)
        Sets up the instance variables of this class depending on which player is in the setup phase
        Parameters:
        scn - - The scene of the game. changes the root as the display changes.
        shipLen - - an integer of the ship length of the button clicked in the setup phase
        rt - - a BorderPane layout. This is the layout made in SetupPhase class
        playerSettingUp - - a String indicating which player is setting up
        numOfShips - - an integer indicating the number of ships left to setup.
        bigBoard - - a BoardGUI instance of the large board representing the player's own board

    • Method Detail

      • handle

        public void handle(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
        When a button is clicked from the right pane of the setup display, it sets the info of the ship based on what button was clicked. All checks are done so that ships can be placed with no conflicts. will change to the next player a turn is done. When mode is player vs ai, it continues directly into the game i.e the attack phase.
        Specified by:
        handle in interface javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent>

      • rightPanel

        public javafx.scene.layout.GridPane rightPanel()
        different layout for right panel when ship is picked. has an indicator for orientation and a cancel button When cancel button is clicked, it displays the setup phase with no changes on the board and the ship count.
        Returns:
        a GridPane layout that is setup to display the orientation of the currently held ship and also adds a cancel button to cancel the ship choice

      • p2Setup

        public javafx.scene.layout.VBox p2Setup()
        Only for PvP. When player 1 setup phase is done, the display changes into another screen with a button at the center. This is to prevent the second player from seeing the previous player's board setup. When ready, player 2 clicks the button the start his/her own setup phase
        Returns:
        a BorderPane layout that displays the transition screen after player one's setup phase is done.

      • startGameTransitionScreen

        public javafx.scene.layout.VBox startGameTransitionScreen()
        When setup is finished, this transition screen informs the players that the game will start with player 1 making the turn first Then it calls AttackPhase when the continue button is clicked.
        Returns:
        a VBox layout
